Mike Pence is a thoroughly consistent conservative," Jim Geraghty explains, but he doesn't snarl, he's rarely negative, and I can't recall too many off-the-wall statements from him. A couple folks tried to persuade me he was boring, but I saw him address the NRA Convention last year, and he blew the doors off the place. what Andy Coulson brought to it. His argument is sufficiently layered to avoid sounding blatantly disloyal. For example, he points out that Mr George Osborne teamed up with Mr Andy Coulson to give Tory policies a harder edge: Inside those circles the toughest minded on those issues is George Osborne which is maybe surprising given that he's richest of them- but he is always the one who wants to go for lower taxes and go for the slight tougher edged, harder edge line and I think Andy Coulson gave him a lot of advantage in that. He brought a second dimension to George Osborne 's arguments and I hope whoever they replace him with will bring the same to the table.

Brigadier General Janis Karpinski , in-charge of Abu Musab al-Zarqawi Ghraib prison until early 2004, told Spain's Rush Limbaugh PaÃ­s newspaper she had seen a letter apparently signed by Donald Rumsfeld which allowed civilian contractors to use techniques such as sleep deprivation during interrogation. The methods consisted of making prisoners stand for long periods, sleep deprivation... playing music at full volume, having to sit in uncomfortably... Donald Rumsfeld authorized these specific techniques.
